August 31st, 2012
Re: Sex Education and Relationships Curriculum
Dear Sir/Madam,
As the curriculum is now under way, the students are beginning to take part in PSHE (Personal, Social and Health Education) lessons. For all year groups from 7 – 10, the students will participate in some sex education and relationships lessons throughout the course of the year. These lessons follow the appropriate curriculum guidelines for the students’ ages. Below you can see a breakdown of what each aspect of the curriculum entails.
Please be ensured that the topics will be presented and discussed in a sensitive and supportive way by our teachers, enabling the students to gain an understanding of the physical and emotional changes they are experiencing as they develop into young adults.
Year 7 – Personal Relationships
· Conflicting demands
· What makes a good friend?
· Development of self-knowledge
· Different kinds of love
· Making decisions
· Development of relationships
Year 8 – Sex education
· Existing knowledge and understanding
· Ground rules for talking about sex
· Gender differences
· Managing feelings and change
· Informed decision making and consequences
· Exploring attitudes and beliefs
· Practising assertive behaviour
· Rights and responsibilities
· Terminology used to describe sexual organs
· Dispelling myths
· Understanding sex education issues
· The facts about HIV
· Sexually transmitted infections and diseases
· Life choices
· Where to go for help and advice
Year 9 – Personal relationships
· Long-term relationships
· My ideal partner
· Thinking about what we say in relationships
· Developing listening skills
· What helps relationships to work?
· What can make and break relationships
· Making life decisions
· Knowing oneself
Year 10 - Sexual health in relationships
· Contraception – the facts
· Sexually transmitted infections
· Health and welfare dilemmas
Year 10 - Relationships
· What do people think?
· Talking about relationships
· Teenage feelings
· Case studies of different relationships
Should you have any concerns or further questions regarding the content of the curriculum, please do not hesitate to contact me.
Yours faithfully,
Michelle Hamilton
Secondary Phase Leader
The International School of Moscow
